Transcriptome analysis pipeline¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

The transcriptome analysis pipeline examines various gene/transcript sets and attempts to interprete and compare them. Among the quantities that it computes are:

  • coding potential (using CPC)

  • overlap with repeats

  • substitution rates

  • conservation
    • with respect to ancestral repeat rates)
    • TODO: conservation (with respect to UCSC tracks)
  • annotation with respect to a reference gene set, for example
    • location (intronic, exonic, intergenic, ...)
    • distance to closest gene
    • intron overrun

Usage¶

See Setting up a pipeline and Running a pipeline on general information how to use CGAT pipelines.

Configuration¶

The pipeline requires a configured pipeline.ini file.

The sphinxreport report requires a conf.py and sphinxreport.ini file (see Building pipeline reports). To start with, use the files supplied with the Example data.

Input¶

The pipeline works from gene sets in gtf format within the working directory.

Requirements¶

The pipeline requires the results from Annotation pipeline and Ancestral repeats pipeline.

On top of the default CGAT setup, the pipeline requires the following software to be in the path:

Program Version Purpose
CPC >=0.9-r2 prediction of coding potential

Example¶

Example data is available at http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_transcriptome.tgz. To run the example, simply unpack and untar:

wget http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_transcriptome.tgz
tar -xvzf pipeline_transcriptome.tgz
cd pipeline_transcriptome
python <srcdir>/pipeline_transcriptome.py make full

Note

For the pipeline to run, install the Annotation pipeline and Ancestral repeats pipeline as well.

Glossary¶

Code¶

pipeline_transcriptome.getSourceTrack(track, all_tracks)¶

if track is in derived tracks, get the source track.

returns None if track is not a derived track

pipeline_transcriptome.getRelatedTracks(track, all_tracks)¶

return tracks in all_tracks that are related to track (including itself)

related tracks are build by merging or slicing another track.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildRepeatTrack(infile, outfile)¶

build a repeat track as negative control.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildIntronTrack(infile, outfile)¶

build an intron track as negative control.

The intron track is build from ancestral repeats. Here, repeats are taken as exons, and artifical genes are constructed from 2 to 5 ancestral repeats at least 100 bases apart, but within 10 kb of each other.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadRepeatInformation(infiles, outfile)¶

load genome information.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildMergedTracks(infiles, outfile)¶

merge gtf transcripts across all data sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildFilteredAlignment(infiles, outfile)¶

build a genomic alignment without exons from the reference gene set.

This alignment is used for rate computation within introns.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildAlignmentStats(infile, outfile)¶

build alignment statistics.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadGTF(infile, outfile)¶

load gtf files.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildAnnotations(infiles, outfile)¶

annotate transcripts by location (intergenic, intronic, ...)

pipeline_transcriptome.loadAnnotations(infile, outfile)¶

load annotations

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverrun(infiles, outfile)¶

compute intron overrun.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadOverrun(infile, outfile)¶

load annotations

pipeline_transcriptome.makeDistances(infiles, outfile)¶

compute intron overrun.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadDistances(infile, outfile)¶

load annotations

pipeline_transcriptome.makeSegments(infile, outfile)¶

compute intron overrun.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadSegments(infile, outfile)¶

load segments

pipeline_transcriptome.makeRepeats(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlap with repeats

pipeline_transcriptome.loadRepeats(infile, outfile)¶

load repeat overlap

pipeline_transcriptome.makeDifference(infiles, outfile)¶

compute the difference between two sets

This target computes three differences 1. exon overlap %.diff.{diff,overlap,total,genes_ovl,genes_total,genes_uniq1,genes_uniq2} An intronic transcript will no overlap with an exonic transrcipt. 2. overlap statistics on each gene in set 1: %.diff 3. intron/exon overlap %_genes.diff.{diff,overlap,total,genes_ovl,genes_total,genes_uniq1,genes_uniq2} An intronic transcript will overlap with an exonic transcript.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadDifference(infile, outfile)¶

load overlap

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverlapAll(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlaps between sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverlapUnknown(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlaps between sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverlapAmbiguous(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlaps between sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverlapKnown(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlaps between sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeOverlapPC(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlaps between sets.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadOverlap(infile, outfile)¶

load results of overlap computation.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeMergedOverlap(infile, outfile)¶

compute overlap of a track with the merged set.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildRepeatMaskedSequences(infile, outfile)¶

output sequences masking repeats.

pipeline_transcriptome.runAgainstProteinDatabase(infile, outfile)¶

run blastx.

search on both strands. Note that the CPC default is: only forward strand

pipeline_transcriptome.runFrameFinder(infile, outfile)¶

run FrameFinder

search on both strands (-r TRUE). Note that CPC default is: only forward strand.

pipeline_transcriptome.buildCodingPotential(infile, outfile)¶

run CPC analysis as in the cpc script.

This module runs framefinder and blastx on both strands. It seems to work, but I have not thoroughly tested it. I expect that the false positive rate increases (i.e., predicting non-coding as coding) in cases where the best framefinder match and the best blast match are on opposite strands. In the original CPC, these would be separated.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadCodingPotential(infile, outfile)¶

load annotations

pipeline_transcriptome.exportSequences(infile, outfile)¶

collect sequences from a gtf file.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeRates(infiles, outfile)¶

compute nucleotide substitution rates for transcripts from a gtf file - this applies only for transcripts mapped onto the reference genome.

Sequences from the transcripts are mapped onto the rate genome.

Softmasked sequence will be ignored unless track is in CONTROL_TRACKS.

The longest contiguous block is selected ignoring matches to other parts of the genome.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadRates(infile, outfile)¶

load rates.

Select the longest stretch for each transcript.

pipeline_transcriptome.makeRepeatsRates(infile, outfile)¶

collect ancestral repeats around transcripts and estimate neutral rate.

pipeline_transcriptome.loadRepeatsRates(infile, outfile)¶

load repeat overlap

pipeline_transcriptome.loadSummary(infile, outfile)¶

load several rates into a single convenience table.

pipeline_transcriptome.build_report()¶

build report from scratch.
